post.summary: Sends a SMS message from a phone number that belongs to the authenticated account.

parameters.name: SendMessageRequest
parameters.description: Represents the body of the send message request.

SmsRecipient.description: Recipient details for sending SMS messages.

to.description: The recipient's phone number in E.164 format.

repeatabilityRequestId.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-ID and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-ID is an opaque string representing a client-generated, 36-character hexadecimal case-insensitive encoding of a UUID (GUID), identifier for the request.

repeatabilityFirstSent.description: MUST be sent by clients to specify that a request is repeatable. Repeatability-First-Sent is used to specify the date and time at which the request was first created.eg- Tue, 26 Mar 2019 16:06:51 GMT

SmsSendOptions.description: Optional configuration for sending SMS messages.

enableDeliveryReport.description: Enable this flag to receive a delivery report for this message on the Azure Resource EventGrid.

tag.description: Use this field to provide metadata that will then be sent back in the corresponding Delivery Report.

SendMessageRequest.description: Represents the properties of a send message request.

from.description: The sender's phone number in E.164 format that is owned by the authenticated account.

smsRecipients.description: The recipient's phone number in E.164 format. In this version, a minimum of 1 and upto 100 recipients in the list are supported.

message.description: The contents of the message that will be sent to the recipient. The allowable content is defined by RFC 5724.

SmsSendResponse.description: Response for a successful or multi status send Sms request.

to.description: The recipient's phone number in E.164 format.

messageId.description: The identifier of the outgoing Sms message. Only present if message processed.

repeatabilityResult.description: The result of a repeatable request with one of the case-insensitive values accepted or rejected.

successful.description: Indicates if the message is processed successfully or not.

errorMessage.description: Optional error message in case of 4xx/5xx/repeatable errors.
